name: 勞維俊
objective:
本課程以1950年代以後的西方文學為本，以當代文化批評理論作為分析基礎，如互文性、族群研究、（後）殖民主義、魔幻寫實主義、女性主義、傷痕記憶等。課程討論重點概念將包括論述、再現、心理分析、後結構主義、後現代主義等。

Course Aims
This course introduces the vast field of contemporary literature after the 1950’s, from late modernist to postmodernist works. Both literary and films, with a few translated into English from other languages, are discussed in terms of literary critical concepts such as intertextuality, post-colonialism, magic realism, feminism, and trauma.
schedule:
Course Outline 

Week 1: Introduction: Modernism, Postmodernism, and Narrative: Jorge Luis Borges, ‘The Garden of Forking Paths’, and ‘Pierre Menard, Author of the Quixote’

Week 2: Kafka, The Trial (extract)

Week 3: Borges, ‘Kafka and his Precursors’

Week 4: Hiroshima mon amour (1959, dir. Alain Resnais)

Week 5: Hiroshima mon amour continued + Freud, Beyond the Pleasure Principle

Week 6: Cathy Caruth, Unclaimed Experience 

Week 7: Holiday (No class) (Mid-term paper draft due)

Week 8: Kleist, ‘On the Marionette Theater’ + The Puppetmaster (1993, dir. Hou Hsiao-Hsien)

Week 9: Mid-term paper due

Week 10: Maurice Blanchot, ‘The Instant of My Death’

Week 11: W.G. Sebald, Austerlitz * 

Week 12: W.G. Sebald, Austerlitz continued

Week 13: Shakespearean Journeys Conference 15-18 May (No class)

Week 14: Calvino, If on a Winter’s Night a Traveler *

Week 15: Derrida Today Conference 28-31 May (No class)

Week 16: The Day He Arrives (dir. Hong Sang-soo)

Week 17: Presentation 

Week 18: Final paper due
scorePolicy:
Teaching Approach

Students are required to read all the assigned texts. On top of literary texts, students will have to do some readings on theories and criticisms, since it would be necessary for them to be equipped with certain understanding of key words and critical terms. Students are required to give a 20 – 25 minutes presentation, write a mid-term and a final paper.

Assessment

Continuous Assessment: 　　100%

Participation　　　　　　　　10%
Presentation 　　　　　　　　20%
Mid-term essay　　　　　　30% (10% draft + 20% revised version)
Final essay  　　　　　　　　40% (10% draft + 30% revised version)
